intro: Notanthera anceps, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Notanthera anceps is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
